entry.title: Flaco (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that having lived in Central Park for more than a year after becoming homeless, Flaco (pictured) has been accused of being a peeping tom?

entry.title: Xiang Xuan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that nine-year-old Xiang Xuan was the youngest soldier to take part in the Long March?

entry.title: Native American genocide in the United States (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that because the Cherokee people were deliberately routed through cholera-stricken areas, their dislocation has been given as an example of Native American genocide in the United States?

entry.title: John A. Roush (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Centre College hosted two vice-presidential debates during John A. Roush's presidency?

entry.title: girl soldiers (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that former girl soldiers may face higher rates of community rejection than former boy soldiers?

entry.title: Bambie Thug (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ireland's 2024 Eurovision entrant Bambie Thug describes their musical genre as "ouija pop"?

entry.title: Campbell's Soup Cans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Campbell Soup considered suing Andy Warhol for his Campbell's Soup Cans theme, but then promoted it?

entry.title: Ove Jørgensen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Ove Jørgensen, after giving his name to a law of Homeric poetry, renounced classical studies to write about ballet?
